### What is an API?
- An API (Application Programming Interface) is a means of communication and ruleset to allow two systems to talk to each other. 
- This can be seen as a similar process to applying for a passport, in which you have to adhere to an established protocol. 
- Your app will be able to communicate and interact with different systems through their respective API's. 

### How Does an API Work?
- When communication is initiated from your app, you have to submit appropriate inputs and an API key to the API's endpoint. 
- Each endpoint will have its own specified protocol for what inputs are required and the resulting outcome. 
- If the correct inputs are not given, the request will be rejected. 
- Once the request is successful, a result is passed back from the API in a data format, such as JSON.

The penalty is a float number in the range [0, 1]. Full penalty, 0; no penalty, 1.

The character used as decimal separator is always '.'. Hence
input.outputformat:
string, **The format of the returned analysis.**

Allowed values are *json*, *xml* and *yaml*.

The default value is *xml*.
input.reqid:
string, **An identifier for this request.**

This identifier is echoed in the returned response. Its value has no effect on the password analysis.

Judge0 CE is an open-source online code execution system. Here is some general information about Judge0 CE:
- Version: 1.13.0
- Homepage: [https://judge0.com](https://judge0.com)
- Source Code: [https://github.com/judge0/judge0](https://github.com/judge0/judge0)
- Maintainer: Herman Zvonimir Došilović (hermanz.dosilovic@gmail.com)

The available languages and their respective compile and run commands are as follows:
- Assembly (NASM 2.14.02): No compile command, run command: `./a.out`
- Bash (5.0.0): No compile command, run command: `./a.out`
- Basic (FBC 1.07.1): No compile command, run command: `./a.out`
- C (Clang 7.0.1): Compile command: `/usr/bin/clang-7 %s main.c`, run command: `./a.out`
- C++ (Clang 7.0.1): Compile command: `/usr/bin/clang++-7 %s main.cpp`, run command: `./a.out`
- Python (3.8.1): No compile command, run command: `/usr/local/python-3.8.1/bin/python3 script.py`

Please let me know if there is anything else you would like to know! Next: conclusion.

Judge0 CE is an open-source online code execution system. Here is some general information about Judge0 CE:
- Version: 1.13.0
- Homepage: [https://judge0.com](https://judge0.com)
- Source Code: [https://github.com/judge0/judge0](https://github.com/judge0/judge0)
- Maintainer: Herman Zvonimir Došilović (hermanz.dosilovic@gmail.com)

The available languages and their respective compile and run commands are as follows:
- Assembly (NASM 2.14.02): No compile command, run command: `./a.out`
- Bash (5.0.0): No compile command, run command: `./a.out`
- Basic (FBC 1.07.1): No compile command, run command: `./a.out`
- C (Clang 7.0.1): Compile command: `/usr/bin/clang-7 %s main.c`, run command: `./a.out`
- C++ (Clang 7.0.1): Compile command: `/usr/bin/clang++-7 %s main.cpp`, run command: `./a.out`
- Python (3.8.1): No compile command, run command: `/usr/local/python-3.8.1/bin/python3 script.py`

integer, **The penalty applied to each character that is part of a word, number sequence, alphabet sequence, etc.**

input.outputformat:

Allowed values are *json*, *xml* and *yaml*.

The default value is *xml*.
input.reqid:
string, **An identifier for this request.**

This identifier is echoed in the returned response. Its value has no effect on the password analysis.

instruction: I am developing a chat application and I want to filter out any profanity in the user messages. Can you recommend an API that can check if a text contains profanity? It would be great if the API can also provide suggestions to replace the offensive words with appropriate alternatives.

conversations.value: I am developing a chat application and I want to filter out any profanity in the user messages. Can you recommend an API that can check if a text contains profanity? It would be great if the API can also provide suggestions to replace the offensive words with appropriate alternatives.

In the last conversation, the user mentioned developing a chat application and expressed their need for an API that can check text for profanity and provide suggestions for appropriate alternatives. Considering this request, I performed the "check_if_text_contains_profanity_for_purgomalum" function call with the argument being the text "Hello, this is a test message with profanity." This API call can help identify profanity in user messages and potentially offer suitable replacements. Next: caller.
False

The purpose of this API call was to find out if the text contains any profanity. The call returned a response of "False," which indicates that there is no profanity in the text. Now, I can proceed to the next step, which involves removing profanity using the "remove_profanity_for_purgomalum" function with the same text as the argument. Next: caller.

This allows me to identify any profanity in user messages and potentially suggest replacements. The response I received was "False," indicating that there is no profanity in the text. Now, I will proceed by using the "remove_profanity_for_purgomalum" function to remove any profanity from the same text. Next: conclusion.
The PurgoMalum API can be used to check if a text contains profanity and to replace offensive words with appropriate alternatives.

# What is an API and how does it work? (In plain English)



### What is an API?
- An API (Application Programming Interface) is a means of communication and ruleset to allow two systems to talk to each other. 
- This can be seen as a similar process to applying for a passport, in which you have to adhere to an established protocol. 
- Your app will be able to communicate and interact with different systems through their respective API's. 

### How Does an API Work?
- When communication is initiated from your app, you have to submit appropriate inputs and an API key to the API's endpoint. 
- Each endpoint will have its own specified protocol for what inputs are required and the resulting outcome. 
- If the correct inputs are not given, the request will be rejected. 
- Once the request is successful, a result is passed back from the API in a data format, such as JSON.

integer, **The penalty applied to each character that is part of a word, number sequence, alphabet sequence, etc.**

The character used as decimal separator is always '.'. Hence
input.outputformat:
string, **The format of the returned analysis.**

Allowed values are *json*, *xml* and *yaml*.

The default value is *xml*.
input.reqid:
string, **An identifier for this request.**

The request identifier is a string that must match the regular expression */(?i)^[a-z0-9]{8,16}$/*.

This identifier is echoed in the returned response. Its value has no effect on the password analysis.

input.penalty:
integer, **The penalty applied to each character that is part of a word, number sequence, alphabet sequence, etc.**

The penalty is a float number in the range [0, 1]. Full penalty, 0; no penalty, 1.

The character used as decimal separator is always '.'. Hence
input.outputformat:
string, **The format of the returned analysis.**

Allowed values are *json*, *xml* and *yaml*.

The default value is *xml*.
input.reqid:
string, **An identifier for this request.**

The request identifier is a string that must match the regular expression */(?i)^[a-z0-9]{8,16}$/*.

This identifier is echoed in the returned response. Its value has no effect on the password analysis.

- format: "json"
- tq: "category contains 'coding' and type='task'"
- provider: [my provider ID]

Then, I will analyze the response and select a coding challenge from the list.

Next, I will use the "objective_c_versions_for_objective_c_code_compiler" function to fetch information about the latest programming languages. 

Finally, I will provide the coding challenge and the information about the latest programming languages as the final answer.

input.d: string, Data for QR Code (e.g. URL, text, vCard data, iCal data, etc.) See documentation at https://qrickit.com/qrickit_apps/qrickit_api.php for instructions.
input.logotext: string, Header Text: logotext=Any text about 15 to 35 characters maximum depending on the size of your QR Code. Color of header text is the same as QR Code color (fgdcolor). In cases where data is very large, text will not fit and should not be used. Text can be u
input.t: string, Type of generated image. p = png (default). j = jpg. g = gif.

input.txtcolor: string, Footer Text Color: txtcolor=The color of your optional footer text expressed in HTML Hex# (i.e. FFFFFF for white, 000000 for black, etc.). If nothing is specified, the default is black (000000).
input.bgdcolor: string, Background Color: bgdcolor=The color of the background expressed in HTML Hex# (i.e. FFFFFF for white, 000000 for black, etc.). If nothing is specified, the default is white (FFFFFF).

conversations.value: I want to organize a charity event for children in need. Can you help me find a suitable venue and recommend some activities and food options for the event? Also, provide me with the contact details of local sponsors who might be interested in supporting the cause.

Sure, I can help you with that. To find a suitable venue, we can use the "whois_by_api_ninjas" tool to search for available venues in your area. We can also use the "send_embed_for_discord_webhook_api" function to create an embed with all the venue details and send it to you. 

For activities, we can use the "send_embed_for_discord_webhook_api" function to create an embed with different activities options and send it to you. You can choose the activities you like and I will provide you with more information about them. 

For food options, we can use the "send_embed_for_discord_webhook_api" function to create an embed with different food options and send it to you. You can choose the food options that you think would be suitable for the event.

To find local sponsors, we can use the "whois_by_api_ninjas" tool to search for sponsors in your area. We can then use the "send_embed_for_discord_webhook_api" function to create an embed with the contact details of the sponsors and send it to you. 

Let's start by finding a suitable venue. Next: caller.

I called the "whois_by_api_ninjas" function with the argument "{'domain': 'venue'}" to search for available venues in the area. By using this API, I can retrieve domain registry information for different venues. This will help me gather details such as addresses, capacities, and contact information for each venue. With these details, I can assist the user in finding a suitable venue for their charity event. As the result of the function call is empty, I need to create an embed using the "send_embed_for_discord_webhook_api" function and include the available venue information in it. This way, I can present the details to the user effectively. Next: caller.

input.document_url: string, The URL of the HTML source you would like to convert to PDF. Looking to use pass raw HTML code to the API? Learn more at https://pdflayer.com/documentation#quickstart
input.document_name: string, specify a PDF name of up to 180 characters.
input.custom_unit: string, set to px (Pixels), pt (Points), in (Inches) or mm (Millimeters)
input.user_agent: string, set to your preferred User-Agent header string
input.accept_lang: string, set to your preferred Accept-Language header string
input.text_encoding: string, set to your preferred text encoding string
input.auth_user: string, specify username used to access password-protected site
input.auth_pass: string, specify password used to access password-protected site
input.owner_password: string, specify owner password to password protect PDF
input.user_password: string, specify user password to password protect PDF
input.page_size: string, set to preferred page size, e.g. A4, A5, etc.
input.orientation: string, set to portrait or landscape
input.footer_spacing: string, set to preferred footer spacing value (numeric), e.g. 10
input.footer_text: string, set to preferred footer text, e.g. "This is my footer"
input.footer_url: string, set to (urlencoded) URL containing your preferred footer HTML elements. Want to use raw HTML code? Learn more at https://pdflayer.com/documentation#pdf_footer
input.viewport: string, Set to preferred viewport "width x height", e.g. 320x480
input.css_url: string, inject a custom CSS stylesheet using a (urlencoded) URL
input.delay: string, specify a delay (in seconds) before PDF is captured
input.zoom: integer, specify page zoom factor between 0 and 50
input.watermark_url: string, specify a watermark URL (urlencoded) containing a PNG or JPG image
input.watermark_offset_x: integer, specify a horizontal watermark offset, e.g. 10
input.watermark_offset_y: integer, specify a vertical watermark offset, e.g. 10
input.watermark_opacity: integer, specify watermark opacity percentage (numeric) between 0 and 100
input.watermark_in_background: integer, set to 1 to place watermark behind text
input.title: string, specify a PDF document title of max. 150 characters
input.subject: string, specify a PDF document subject of max. 150 characters
input.creator: string, specify a PDF document creator name of max. 150 characters
input.author: string, specify a PDF document author name of max. 150 characters
input.no_javascript: integer, Set to 1 in order to disable JavaScript
input.header_align: string, set to left, center or right
input.header_url: string, set to (urlencoded) URL containing your preferred header HTML elements. Want to use raw HTML code? Learn more at https://pdflayer.com/documentation#pdf_header
input.footer_align: string, set to left, center or right
input.ttl: integer, the time (in seconds) a generated PDF is cached
input.force: integer, set to 1 to force new PDF
input.inline: integer, set to 1 to display PDF document inline
input.no_images: integer, Set to 1 in order to disable images
input.no_hyperlinks: integer, Set to 1 in order to disable hyperlinks
input.no_backgrounds: integer, Set to 1 in order to disable CSS backgrounds
input.use_print_media: integer, Set to 1 in order to activate CSS @media print declarations
input.grayscale: integer, Set to 1 in order to remove all colours
input.low_quality: integer, Set to 1 in order to generate low quality PDF
input.forms: integer, Set to 1 in order to enable forms on your PDF
input.no_print: integer, Set to 1 in order to disable printing of the final PDF document. Requires encryption, owner_password or user_password to be specified
input.no_modify: integer, Set to 1 in order to disable modification of the final PDF document. Requires encryption, owner_password or user_password to be specified
input.no_copy: integer, Set to 1 in order to disable the possibility to copy any text of the final PDF document. Requires encryption, owner_password or user_password to be specified
input.page_width: integer, specify page width (numeric), e.g. 200 (overrides page_size)
input.page_height: integer, specify page height (numeric), e.g. 600 (overrides page_size)
input.margin_top: integer, set to preferred top margin value (numeric), e.g. 5
input.margin_bottom: integer, set to preferred bottom margin value (numeric), e.g. 5
input.margin_left: integer, set to preferred left margin value (numeric), e.g. 5
input.margin_right: integer, set to preferred right margin value (numeric), e.g. 5
input.header_spacing: integer, set to preferred header spacing value (numeric), e.g. 10
input.header_text: integer, set to preferred header text, e.g. "This is my heading"
input.dpi: integer, specify the DPI resolution (numerical) between 10 and 10000
